content_summary: The speaker, Michael Levin, discusses the concept of bioelectricity and its role in tissue regeneration. He explains how tissues have a 'memory' that dictates their regeneration process, even in the absence of genetic changes. He likens this to the brain's ability to 'time travel', storing and recalling patterns not reflective of the current state.
